description: From Old French embruer, from Germanic.

verbs.description: imbrue (third-person singular simple present imbrues, present participle imbruing, simple past and past participle imbrued)

entries.meaning: To stain (in, with, blood, slaughter, etc.).
examples: Armed with the weapon which was destined to destroy himself, Imnaz sprang down the ladder, — found the door, and, emerging from the abode of crime, sought a more secure resting place, leaving his hostess to discover, with return of day, in whose blood were imbrued the hands of an hospiticide.
